MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool A_0) cil managed

Docs.param: to release managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Called by the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymBinder.Dispose%2A> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymBinder.Finalize%2A> methods to release the managed and unmanaged resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called only by the public <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymBinder.Dispose%2A> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymBinder.Finalize%2A> methods; do not call this method directly.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Finalize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases the resources held by the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method overrides <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A>. Application code should not call this method; an object's `Finalize` method is automatically invoked during garbage collection, unless finalization by the garbage collector has been disabled by a call to the <xref:System.GC.SuppressFinalize%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.ISymbolReader GetReader (int importer, string filename, string searchPath);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.ISymbolReader GetReader(int32 importer, string filename, string searchPath) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is SymBinder.GetReader(IntPtr, String). ISymbolBinder1.GetReader takes the importer interface pointer as an IntPtr instead of an Int32, and thus works on both 32-bit and 64-bit architectures. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.param: A 32-bit integer that points to the metadata import interface.
The name of the file for which the reader interface is required.
The search path used to locate the symbol file.
Docs.summary: Gets the interface of the symbol reader for the current file, using the specified 32-bit integer pointer to a metadata interface, the specified file name, and the specified search path.
Docs.returns: The interface that reads the debugging symbols.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When given a pointer to a metadata interface, a file name, and a search path, the GetReader method returns the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.ISymbolReader> interface that reads the debugging symbols associated with the module.
> [!NOTE] > Using a 32-bit integer as a pointer is not recommended. Use the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore.SymBinder.GetReader%2A> overload instead.

Docs.permission: for the ability to access unmanaged code. Security action: . Associated enumeration:
